Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant misrepresented material facts in her permanent residence application
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 40(1)(a)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of administrative immigration decision
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Temporary and permanent residence applications, applicant's statements
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Inconsistencies in declared profession (lawyer vs. business manager)
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Materiality of misrepresentation and potential to induce error
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Discrepancies in professional occupation between applications
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative review followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Misrepresentation of profession and employment history
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Misrepresentation under IRPA leading to inadmissibility
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Inadmissible for two years due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Credibility of applicant’s explanation for discrepancies
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Discrepancies in profession and employment between temporary and permanent residence applications
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Fairness letter issued prior to decision
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant blamed travel agency but admitted signing both applications
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed errors were due to travel agency or forgetfulness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Proper notice and opportunity to respond

Crimes.Crime_Name: Withholding material facts under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant withheld or misrepresented material facts in her permanent residence application
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 40(1)(a)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Administrative decision followed by judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Permanent and temporary residence applications, applicant's testimony
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Failure to disclose consistent professional information
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Materiality of omission and potential to induce error
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistent reporting of profession and legal training
Crimes.Application_Error: Omission or misrepresentation of legal training and job title
Crimes.Application_Factor: Accuracy of information provided in immigration forms
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Credibility of applicant's justification for inconsistencies
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Discrepancies regarding profession and legal training in immigration applications
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Lack of可信 explanation for discrepancies
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Attributed errors to travel agency or memory lapse
Crimes.Omission_Type: Withholding accurate details about professional background
